channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trial Begins for Former Officer Over Uvalde School Shooting Response
item.description: Families of the victims and survivors of the 2022 elementary school shooting in Texas are expected to testify.

item.title: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz Abandons Re-election Bid and Amy Klobuchar May Run Instead
item.description: Mr. Walz and Ms. Klobuchar met on Sunday in Minnesota, where he informed her of his plans and she confirmed her interest in running to succeed him as ...

item.title: Gunboat Diplomacy Is Back. What Could Go Wrong?
item.description: The high cost of forgetting what world war is really like.

item.title: If entry-level jobs disappear, who becomes a CEO?
item.description: As AI takes over early career work, companies are rethinking how leaders are made.

item.title: After Venezuela, Trump Offers Hints About What Could Be Next
item.description: President Trump’s comments about Greenland, Colombia and Cuba offered a glimpse of how emboldened he feels after the quick capture of Nicolás Maduro.

item.title: Chevron stock is spiking after the U.S. raid on Venezuela
item.description: The price of U.S. crude oil gained 1% after U.S. forces captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro in a weekend raid.

item.title: Crystal Ball: Will the AI bubble burst or balloon in 2026?
item.description: For the first installment of the Term Sheet 2026 Crystal Ball, we look at what readers say about one of the most pressing questions of our time: What ...

item.title: Ethereum has long talked a big game. Now it’s time for the second biggest blockchain to deliver
item.description: Cofounder Vitalik Buterin offers a bracing wake-up message for 2026.

item.title: While worker bonuses decrease, pay transparency is on the rise in 2026
item.description: Less than 40% of employees received a bonus last year, down from 44% in 2021, according to new data from ADP.

item.title: Denmark Tells Trump to ‘Stop the Threats’ About Greenland
item.description: The Danish prime minister told President Trump to back down after he repeated his threat to acquire Greenland in the wake of the U.S. military raid in...

item.title: Trump Says ‘We Need Greenland’ and Threatens U.S. Action in Colombia and Mexico

item.title: JD Vance’s Ohio Home Is Targeted in Vandalism Attack
item.description: U.S. Secret Service agents detained a man early Monday after the vice president’s home in Cincinnati was damaged. No injuries were reported.
